page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Brockenhurst Park Stables, now known as Church Lane Stables were built in 1903 by John Morant, then Lord of the Manor, to satisfy his passion for horse racing. Racehorses continued to be trained here until the late l950s, except that during the l939-45 war evacuees from London were accommodated in the bothy. The last horse of fame trained here was LOVELY COTTAGE who won the Grand National in l947 - to the profit of the villagers ! In the late l950s Brockenhurst Park estate was sold; from then until 1975 various tenants rented the stables as a riding school. The present owners have occupied the premises as a private residence since l975 and use the stables to satisfy their joint hobby of horses and horse drawn vehicles.
